desc.pl: WyobraÅº sobie maÅ‚ego kuriera, ktÃ³ry podrÃ³Å¼uje przez caÅ‚e twoje ciaÅ‚o! Hemoglobina to wÅ‚aÅ›nie taki kurier - mieszka w czerwonych krwinkach i dostarcza tlen do wszystkich czÄ™Å›ci ciaÅ‚a. DziÄ™ki niej moÅ¼esz biegaÄ‡, skakaÄ‡ i siÄ™ bawiÄ‡!
desc.en: Imagine a tiny courier traveling through your entire body! Hemoglobin is exactly that - it lives in red blood cells and delivers oxygen to every part of your body. Thanks to it, you can run, jump and play!

desc.en: DNA is a twisted staircase that stores instructions for how to build YOU! Every cell in your body has the same recipe book inside. It contains all the information - your eye color, hair color, and millions of other things!

funFact.en: If you unwound all the DNA from one cell, it would be about 2 meters! And your whole body has so much DNA it would reach the Sun and back!

desc.en: This is your body's superhero! Antibodies look like the letter Y and are warriors fighting germs. When a virus or bacteria enters your body, antibodies catch them like police officers catch thieves!

funFact.en: Your body can create millions of different antibodies - each fits a different villain like a key to a lock!

desc.pl: To sÅ‚ynny 'kolec' koronawirusa COVID-19! Te kolczaste wypustki na powierzchni wirusa wyglÄ…dajÄ… jak korona (stÄ…d nazwa 'korona-wirus'). Wirus uÅ¼ywa ich jak kluczy, Å¼eby wejÅ›Ä‡ do komÃ³rek. Szczepionki uczÄ… twoje ciaÅ‚o rozpoznawaÄ‡ te kolce!
desc.en: This is the famous COVID-19 coronavirus 'spike'! These spiky bumps on the virus surface look like a crown (that's why it's called 'corona-virus'). The virus uses them like keys to enter cells. Vaccines teach your body to recognize these spikes!

funFact.en: Scientists created COVID-19 vaccines in record time - less than a year! This was possible thanks to knowing this spike's structure.

desc.en: This protein comes from jellyfish and glows green like a night light! Scientists use it as a magic marker - they add it to other proteins to see where they hide in cells. Like a flashlight in a dark room!

funFact.en: Scientists got a Nobel Prize for discovering this protein! Now we can make glowing fish, mice, and even cats!

desc.en: tRNA is a tiny postman in your cells! It's shaped like the letter L and carries amino acids (protein building blocks) to the protein factory. It reads DNA instructions and delivers the right blocks to the right place!

funFact.en: In most cells in your body, there are millions of tiny tRNA â€œhelpersâ€ constantly working like an army of postmen!

desc.en: Insulin is a tiny key that opens doors to your cells! When you eat candy or a sandwich, insulin helps sugar from food enter cells to give you energy to play. Without it, cells would be hungry!

funFact.en: Insulin was discovered over 100 years ago and has saved the lives of millions of people with diabetes!

desc.pl: To caÅ‚y wirus Zika â€” zbudowany z tysiÄ™cy malutkich biaÅ‚kowych â€klockÃ³wâ€! Ta biaÅ‚kowa skorupka dziaÅ‚a jak pancerz: chroni wirusa i pomaga mu dostaÄ‡ siÄ™ do komÃ³rek. Komary mogÄ… przenosiÄ‡ wirusa miÄ™dzy ludÅºmi. Naukowcy badajÄ… tÄ™ skorupkÄ™, Å¼eby znaleÅºÄ‡ jej sÅ‚abe miejsca i opracowaÄ‡ leki oraz szczepionki.
desc.en: This is the whole Zika virusâ€”built from thousands of tiny protein â€œbuilding blocksâ€! Its protein shell acts like armor: it protects the virus and helps it enter cells. Mosquitoes can carry the virus from one person to another. Scientists study this shell to spot weak points and develop medicines and vaccines.

funFact.en: This virus shell is almost perfectly round - like a soccer ball made of proteins instead of leather!

desc.en: Myoglobin is like an oxygen storage in your muscles! Just like a battery stores power, myoglobin stores oxygen. When you run fast and muscles need lots of oxygen, myoglobin gives it to them!

desc.en: It's a giant circus tent for proteins! When new proteins are born all twisted and tangled, they enter this tent and come out beautifully arranged. Like a magician turning mess into order!

desc.en: Collagen is the rope your body is built from! Three strings wrap around each other like a braid, creating super strong fibers. Thanks to it, your skin is stretchy and your bones are strong!

funFact.en: Collagen is the most common protein in your body - it makes up 30% of all your proteins!

desc.pl: To wirus polio - kiedyÅ› bardzo groÅºna choroba, ktÃ³ra mogÅ‚a paraliÅ¼owaÄ‡ dzieci! DziÄ™ki szczepionkom prawie go pokonaliÅ›my. Ta kuleczka jest zbudowana z 60 kopii tego samego zestawu biaÅ‚ek, uÅ‚oÅ¼onych jak puzzle!
desc.en: This is the polio virus - once a very dangerous disease that could paralyze children! Thanks to vaccines, we've almost defeated it. This ball is built from 60 copies of the same set of protein, arranged like a puzzle!

desc.pl: Akwaporyna to tunel w bÅ‚onie komÃ³rki, przez ktÃ³ry przepÅ‚ywa woda! Jest tak sprytnie zbudowana, Å¼e przepuszcza tylko wodÄ™, a blokuje wszystko inne.

desc.en: Transferrin is a freight train for iron! It has two wagons that carry iron atoms where they're needed. Iron helps make hemoglobin - without it you would be weak and tired!

funFact.en: Your cells have special â€œpickup stationsâ€ (receptors) that grab transferrin and take iron from itâ€”like receiving a delivered package!

desc.pl: To maszyna, ktÃ³ra Å‚apie Å›wiatÅ‚o sÅ‚oneczne w roÅ›linach! Fotosystem II zbiera energiÄ™ ze SÅ‚oÅ„ca i uÅ¼ywa jej do rozbijania wody. DziÄ™ki niemu roÅ›liny produkujÄ… tlen, ktÃ³rym oddychasz!
desc.en: This is a machine that catches sunlight in plants! Photosystem II collects energy from the Sun and uses it to split water. Thanks to it, plants produce the oxygen you breathe!

funFact.en: All the oxygen in the air you breathe was made by Photosystem II in plants, cyanobacteria and algae!
